intro: Clibadium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. Clibadium micranthum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides.
